content:
Did you enter the 'app specific password' in this location:

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Scroll to Passwords section
  • click on 'Saved Passwords'
  • click on 'Show Passwords'
  • For both the incoming line and the smtp outgoing lines
  • Right click on line and select 'Edit PAssword'
  • Completely clear contents and enter the 'app specific password'
  • When both are done click on 'Close'
  • REstart Thunderbird

Do you use any program that can clean up files like CCleaner or WiseCleaner or even some Anti-Virus products can do this ? They have a habit of deleting temp files, session files and password files, so if you want to use those types of programs then please make Thunderbird profile folders exempt from access.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
If the server does not support imap, pop,smtp protocols then it is not allowing email clients to use those normal protocols.

However, there maybe an addon which could help. It is a paid for addon, but the cost is minimal. This addon does get access to exchange for outlook, so may work for you. Please read info at this link: https://addons.thunderbird.net/en-us/thunderbird/addon/owl-for-exchange/

content:
hello David,

I couldn't figure out how to use what your link took me to, so, by luck I found a place on the web where I could load an exe file for version 115.8.1. The site was "https://thunderbird.en.uptodown.com/windows/versions".

I've installed that exe file and it solved the problem of showing the most recent emails. However, it then went through an automatic update so I was back to that problem again. I installed the 115.8.1 exe file again but then went into Settings to stop the auto update. Instead, apparently in future it will ask if I want to update Thunderbird. So far so good, it has stayed as 115.8.1.

Thankyou for your help
creator: graham65

content: I'm pleased it worked, but I do recommend to get Thunderbird from official sources. Ok, end of sermon. THat site I gave you was for 102.15.1. Not knowing whether you use 32 or 64 bit or what native language, I showed the list of options. For example win64 had the version for windows 64-bit. Once that is clicked, the options for language appears. Thanks for sharing. Good results are always welcome. :)

content: I encourage you to pursue the possibility that other software is interrupting the upgrade, such as an antivirus. Either that, or set to be notified when an update is available, and do backup immediately prior. I do understand your frustration, but many thousands upgrade with no problems.

content: Sorry, absolutely not. AV software is not an issue here, it is communication/incompatibility issues with other platforms such as Google and Hotmail, as indicated. I only use Windows built-in security and it is certainly not interfering. This is an ongoing problem for years now.

content: In that case, I encourage you to document the issue in bugzilla.mozilla.org. I do occasionally see issues with Google and Hotmail, but never in a consistent pattern. Please include whatever info you can so people reading the bug will have opportunity to reproduce it. Thank you.

content: Generally, I recommend unsubscribing from AllMail because it has duplicates of all messages in inbox, sent, etc. - and also increases thunderbird overhead of keeping it in sync. To save messages for an IMAP account, and have the full content, I recommend - click account settings>synchronization&storage - click 'advanced' button and mark desired folders for offline use - click File>offline>download sync - now, highlight and COPY the messages you want saved in Local Folders. Do NOT use MOVE.
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks. This gave me back 1.5GB on my hard drive though those files are still the same size.

content: ok, thx, I'll dig deeper in the msf-files then ... couldn't really find it there when looked before ... and wait for somebody that might know finds this post :-)
creator: frax1

content:
checking the msf files for several folders turning on and off the the "always check" box in the GUI I see these attributes being changed:

(9E=ns:msg:db:row:scope:dbfolderinfo:all) (85=recipients) (86=date) (88=flags) (B0=indexingPriority)

The ID (9E, 85, 86, 88 & B0) varies from folder to folder but the name of the attributes are always the same ...

It looks like the date flag ( [1:^9E(^88^86)] below ) is turned on when enabling the "always check" as well as setting indexingPriority to 30 ( [1:^9E(^B0=30)] below ) something I saw in the global-messages-db.sqlite folderLocations table as well.

Turning it off again the recipients flag is set and the indexingPriority is set to 20.

I'll dig some more and see if I can use this to automate it the way I want :-)

--- a.msf - Always check folder ---

@$${12{@ [1:^9E(^88^86)] @$$}12}@

@$${13{@ [1:^9E(^B0=30)] @$$}13}@

--- a.msf - Don't always check folder --- @$${16{@ [1:^9E(^88^85)] @$$}16}@

@$${17{@ [1:^9E(^B0=20)] @$$}17}@
creator: frax1

content: seems like the only consistent change in the .msf is setting the indexingPriority (the setting of the other attribute was just coincidental)... so now some testing setting that manually in the DB and in the msf
creator: frax1

Please use Google Translate to post in English.

Questions translated: When I insert a link in an email, the link address is different. Hello. I am using Thunderbird Mail. When I insert a link in an email, the link address is different. I gave the link "cafe.naver.com/masterlesson" in "Link Test", but the result is "mail.naver.com/v2/read/0/cafe.naver.com/masterlesson". It is the same even if I use HTML. I sent the email from a Naver Mail account to a Naver Mail account. I added an additional attachment, so please check it and give me a quick reply.

In new Write message Insert > Link Enter Text to display for the link: masterlesson

Link Location Enter a web page location....... https://cafe.naver.com/masterlesson

DO NOT select checkbox 'Attach the source of this link to the message' click on 'OK'

Save as draft. Then in Drafts folder, select saved draft email to read - click on link to check it works ok. It works ok for me.

Maybe these instructions are better:

  • Go to "Settings"

  • Then de-select (switch off) "Contacts, email, calendar and communications history"

content:
Go to settings search for integ Click the "check now" button. Did that pop up the dialog you were talking about?

I had a similar issue post having outlook installed. The uninstall some how messed up the existence of the appropriate files for windows MAPI. There are a number of things you can try, including going to the windows default apps and making sure Thunderbird is registered as your default mail app, news app and calendar app (that is what the check now buttons checks, but when it is a mess you sometimes Thunderbird can not actually reset the values.

Another is reinstall Thunderbird. This is a system integration issue, so uninstalling Thunderbird, rebooting you device and reinstalling Thunderbird may fix the registry that Outlook has left a mess, or reinstall some critical file outlook deleted.

content:
re :On startup TB pops an error box up saying ' There is no email program associated to perform this action'. When dismissed TB continues to open normally.

This error may be the computer and not Thunderbird, otherwise Thunderbird would not work at all. Something in computer is expecting something else.

Check this setting and confirm it was correct or whether you needed to correct it. I've added an image to help as a guide.

Exit Thunderbird if it's running.

Please check registry key: HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Clients\Mail

  • In search type 'Registry' and select 'Registry Editor'
  • (OR in search type 'Run' and select 'Run app' > type regedit and click on 'OK' )

Locate this registry entry:

  • HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Clients\Mail
  • on right side double click on 'Default'
  • Enter Mozilla Thunderbird in 'Value Data'
  • click on 'OK'
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
re :There is no email program associated to perform this action.

This line does not state what the action is, so I've got another idea I need you to test

In Thunderbird

  • Help > Troubleshooting Information
  • Under 'Application Basics' - half way - Profile Folders - click on 'Open Folder'
  • A new window opens showing the contents of your profile name folder.
  • Exit Thunderbird now - this is important.
  • Scroll down and locate this file: prefs.js

Please tell me if you have a lot more of those 'prefs.js files which may have a number eg: prefs-3.js ? Post an image showing those files and make sure you are using columns so we can see info such as size and date etc.

Then make a copy of 'prefs.js' and save it on desktop as a temp backup.

Open the original 'prefs.js' file using a simple text editor like Notepad. scroll down to the section which starts : user_pref("ldap_2.....

Please Post an image which shows all the section of user_pref("ldap_2.servers.....

Do you have anything like the following lines which mention EDS?

  • user_pref("ldap_2.servers.eds.description", "EDS Address Book Bootstrapper");
  • user_pref("ldap_2.servers.eds.dirType", 3);
  • user_pref("ldap_2.servers.eds.filename", "eds.mab");
  • user_pref("ldap_2.servers.eds.position", 1);
  • user_pref("ldap_2.servers.eds.uri", "moz-abedsdirectory://");

If yes, then delete just those lines and close up/remove any empty lines that may occur when you delete those lines. Finally save the file. Then start Thunderbird. Do you still get the error pop up message ?
creator: Toad-Hall

content: Hi again Toad-Hall, checked your first option - Mozilla Thunderbird is set as default. 2nd check : Screenshots attached, and yes - the eds lines were there exactly as listed. I deleted those, saved the file and restarted TB a couple of times to make sure. All is now fine ! Well done and thanks for finding that. Do you have any idea what caused it in the first place ? Must have been something to do with uninstalling MS Office, as far as I can see, from the timeline when it started. Thanks again Nick

content:
Looks like you are trying to create a new mail account for an existing email address.

Thunderbird does not create passwords for mail accounts. You have to logon to your webmail account via a browser in order to set up or modify a password.

If you have forgotten the password then there should be a 'Forgotten Password' link to click on. Then follow instructions in order to get access to account at which point you can reset the password. Once you have set up password, you can then use it to create the mail account.

If you already had this mail account set up in Thunderbird then perhaps you instructed Thunderbird to remember the password. In which case check this location:

  • Settings > Privacy & Security
  • Scroll to Passwords section
  • click on 'Saved Passwords'
  • click on 'show Passwords'

Then use that saved password to see if it gains you access to your webmail account. This means you can check to see if the password is correct.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Hallo Umit,

zo’n verwijdering is alleen op de lokale pc, de account zal dus niet op de andere laptop verdwijnen. Ik ga er wel vanuit dat er niet met een centraal profiel wordt gewerkt, maar dat het in beide gevallen om een lokale installatie van Thunderbird gaat met eigen instellingen. Dit is te controleren door op één van de pc’s de profiellocatie te bekijken (u leest hier hoe dat kan); als die locatie op de pc zelf is en niet op een netwerklocatie, dan is er sprake van een lokale installatie met eigen instellingen.

content:
Try this: launch in safe/troubleshoot mode (hold Shift when starting TB), check 'reset toolbars & controls', 'make changes & restart'.

If that doesn't help, create a new profile and add your (IMAP) accounts: Windowskey+R, type

thunderbird.exe -p

and create a new profile. Address books, local mail, filter rules etc. can be transferred from the old profile to the new if necessary.
creator: sfhowes

content:
Many thanks for your help. The shift-start didn’t work, but the new profile enabled me to get going with my main email addy so this leads me to my next questions…

1. I use QuickFolders. Is there a simple way to copy the settings?

2. Where are the filter rules located - what do I copy?

3. As 2 for everything else I need.

4. Do I have to add all other email addresses one by one, or can I copy those too?

Thanks, Tony
creator: tonyjover

content: Oh… where is this new profile now? I closed TB but when I open it from the desktop icon I’m back to the original broken one.
creator: tonyjover

content: Forget that last question - I’ve managed to find the new profile to use as default.
creator: tonyjover

content:
tonyjover said
Many thanks for your help. The shift-start didn’t work, but the new profile enabled me to get going with my main email addy so this leads me to my next questions… 1. I use QuickFolders. Is there a simple way to copy the settings? 2. Where are the filter rules located - what do I copy? 3. As 2 for everything else I need. 4. Do I have to add all other email addresses one by one, or can I copy those too? Thanks, Tony

1. The settings can be exported and imported, but if the previous profile can't be opened, there is probably a way to copy the settings manually. If the old profile can't be opened in safe mode, delete xulstore.json from the old profile (same as 'reset toolbars...'), then see if it can be opened in normal mode.

2. msgFilterRules.dat in the account subfolders of Mail and ImapMail in the profile can be copied between profiles and accounts.

3. abook.sqlite and history.sqlite (Personal Address Book and Collected Addresses) can be copied from the old profile to the new. Other sqlite, mab, LDIF etc. address books can be imported from Tools/Import.

4. Add the IMAP accounts again and mail on the server will download on first sync. Mail in POP or Local Folders can also be copied manually.
creator: sfhowes

content:

If the old profile can't be opened in safe mode, delete xulstore.json from the old profile (same as 'reset toolbars...'), then see if it can be opened in normal mode.

Thanks for the suggestion but that doesn’t work either. I’ve spent ages comparing the contents of the two profile folders to see if anything jumps out at me (like a wildly different file size) but there’s nothing obvious that I can see.

I’m sure that replacing a single file somewhere will fix the old profile but I’m darned if I can see what it might be. Probably because I don’t know what most of the files are for!

Regards, Tony

content:
Hallo Wiet,

mogelijk is het wachtwoord voor de uitgaande server nog niet bijgewerkt. Deze kan via de accountinstellingen worden bijgewerkt (meer info hier). U zou ook in de wachtwoordenbeheerder kunnen kijken of het wachtwoord daar kan worden gewijzigd (meer info daarover in dit artikel). Ik zou niet adviseren de account te verwijderen en daarna weer te installeren, want dan zijn inderdaad alle instellingen weg, en afhankelijk van de accountinstellingen mogelijk ook berichten.

Succes, ik hoor graag of het met bovenstaande handleidingen lukt!
creator: markh2

content:
Hoi Mark

Ik ben bezig geweest en heb van alles geprobeerd. Het lijkt dus idd dat mijn nieuwe wachtwoorden er wel inzitten maar nog steeds hetzelfde probleem.

Nu heb ik dus ondertussen veel geprobeerd en zag ineens mijn instellingen voor de smtp server die staan opo Poort 587 Verbindingsbeveiliging start TTLS ( en ik vraag me af of ik die misschien hier per ongeluk op heb gezet en dat die ergens anders op moet staat)? Normaal wachtwoord.

Kunnen deze instellingen misschien nog iet smet mijn probleem te maken hebben? Trouwens als ik mijn virusscanner uitzet kan ik nog steeds niet mail verzenden ( maar dus wel ontvangen). Groetjes Wiet
creator: wietadriaansens

content:
De instellingen voor de uitgaande server voor Ziggo zijn volgens https://www.ziggo.nl/klantenservice/e-mail/serverinstellingen: 

Uitgaande server    server: smtp.ziggo.nl    serverpoort: 587    type versleuteling: STARTTLS, TLS of SSL    verificatie vereist: ja    gebruikersnaam: volledig e-mailadres    wachtwoord: e-mailwachtwoord

Een oplossing kan zijn door het huidige wachtwoord te verwijderen als uitgelegd op https://support.mozilla.org/nl/kb/wachtwoordenbeheerder-onthouden-verwijderen-tb#w_wachtwoorden-verwijderen-of-bewerken. Als het goed is zal Thunderbird dan om het (nieuwe) wachtwoord vragen.
creator: Fjoerfoks

Maar als ik een bericht wil verzenden blijft hij maar om een wachtwoord vragen ( tot 2x toe/ daarna komt dan de melding dat hij geen verbinding met de uitgaande smtp server kan maken). En dus kan ik ook nog steeds niet mailen. Ik snap er niet meer zoveel van ( en ik ben er al geen held in :-)) Maar misschien komt er nog een oplossing? Groetjes Wiet

content: Dat wijst er toch op dat het wachtwoord dat naar de uitgaande server wordt verzonden (let op, dat is niet dezelfde server als voor inkomende berichten) niet juist is. Probeer bij de serverinstellingen de instellingen voor de smtp-server nog eens in te voeren, wellicht dat dat het probleem oplost. Is het mogelijk om een schermafdruk te maken van de melding die u ontvangt (zonder persoonlijke gegevens prijs te geven) en dit toe te voegen in een reactie?
creator: markh2

content:
Hoi Mark Hieronder mijn schermafbeeldingen. Mocht er iets op staan wat niet veilig is ( ik heb het geprobeerd) zou jij het dan willen verwijderen?

De bijlage zijn de mededelingen als ik dus een bericht wil versturen. Eerst gaat hij lang verzenden.. Dan de melding dat ik mijn wachtwoord in moet vullen Die melding komt bijna altijd 2 keer . En op het laatst de melding dat hij niet kan verbinden.

Wat ik wel zag ( en ik weet niet hoe en wanneer dat gebeurt is) is dat ik 2 accounts heb staan van mijn naam ( precies het zelfde) in thunderbirds. Alleen is de ene account een imap account en de ander een pop.

Dus 1 account is pop.ziggo.nl Uitgaande server ziggo mail-SMTP. ziggo.nl ( standaard) De andere ( precies dezelfde gebruikersnaam) servernaam imap.ziggo.nl uitgaande server ziggo mail- SMTP.ziggo.nl( standaard) ( precies hetzelfde al die andere dus.

Ik hoop dat jij hier iets mee kunt doen? Ik weet dat ik soms onduidelijk ben. komt gewoon omdat ik hier de "ballen"verstand van heb. Jullie allemaal alvast heel erg bedankt voor jullie geduld en hulp. Groetjes Wiet
creator: wietadriaansens

content: Ik weet niet of je het al hebt geprobeerd, maar een optie is om de wachtwoorden voor smtp.ziggo.nl te verwijderen, Thunderbird af te sluiten en weer te starten en dan een bericht te versturen. Als het goed is vraagt Thunderbird dan weer om het wachtwoord met de optie om het te bewaren. Een andere optie is om Thunderbird opnieuw te installeren met een download vanaf https://www.thunderbird.net/nl/. De oude hoeft niet te worden verwijderd en de gegevens zullen intact blijven.

content: Twee dezelfde accounts naast elkaar zou een probleem kunnen zijn en is ook niet nodig. U kunt overwegen een ervan te verwijderen. Aan u de keuze of de IMAP- of POP-account zou moeten sneuvelen, lees dit artikel voor de verschillen. De volgende artikelen kunnen ook nog aanvullende informatie geven over omschakelen: https://support.mozilla.org/nl/kb/faq-imap-naar-pop-wijzigen https://support.mozilla.org/nl/kb/wisselen-pop-imap-account

content:
• Account IMAP o POP3?
  • Sul server le mail sono presenti?
  • Nello stesso periodo ha rinnovato il dominio? Lo hai rinnovato in ritardo?
  • Hai lo stesso problema avviando Thunderbird in Modalità risoluzione dei problemi? -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/modalita-risoluzione-problemi-thunderbird
  • A quando risale l'ultimo backup?
creator: @next

content: Ringrazio della risposta. Account POP3, le mail su Aruba ci sono e le vedo se vado direttamente, rinnovato prima della scadenza che è il 16/6/24 però comunque non le vedo da fine aprile e avevo già sollevato il problema ma senza risposta da Thunde..., in modalità di soluzione rimane lo stesso problema e non cambia nulla sempre riquadro bianco, come hai visto dalla foto i recapiti della mail ci sono sempre. Backup, qualche mese fa fatto da me, ma dovrebbe andare in automatico con antivirus su cloud, da quanto ne capisco, ma non sono bravo e a 70 anni il Pc è sempre una sorpresa... Se puoi darmi ancora qualche soluzione... perchè uso Thund. da moltissimi anni e in generale senza problemi grossi, grazie, Marino
creator: marinokermac

content:
Dalla webmail di Aruba trova una delle email che Thunderbird mostra bianca, e marcala come Non letta. Avvia quindi Thunderbird e controlla se la mail in questione viene recuperata correttamente.

Se questa procedura non funziona, bisogna intervenire sul database di Thunderbird:

  1. Fai un backup -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compatta le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Rigenera l'indice -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale

Se anche così non risolvi, prova a riparare la cartella che contiene le mail bianche

  • click con il tasto destro del mouse sulla cartella -> Proprietà -> Riapra cartella
creator: @next

content: Problem fixed. Outgoing Mail Server settings updated per information provided by my internet service provider (Digital Space).
